ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I engaged with a variety of advanced insights into political philosophy with exposure to variety of vantage points and a vibrant community of critical voices representing a diversity of disciplines.

This course challenged me intellectually and added considerable depth and breadth to my knowledge of political theory and philosophy. I was able to frame the course themes in light of scholarship far different from what I normally engage with. I gained new perspective and have been able to cultivate more complex thinking on the themes of citizenship, national belonging, and exile.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought it was difficult to make sense of the overall 'point' of this course. Some of the reading (e.g., Judith Butler) was especially difficult and I thought we could have spent more of the class discussing the arguments in depth with guidance from Professor Benhabib instead of leaning so heavily on the student responsible for writing a response paper.
Strength: High difficulty of discourse. Weaknesses: what I bring to the table - this course, more than any other, sends me away with a genuine necessity/desire to read more.
I enjoyed the format of weekly presenters with ample time for Professor Benhabib to lecture. I also found the final week's guest speaker a helpful addition.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, though in large part I would be recommending the professor over the course itself. Professor Benhabib was excellent and I am glad to have had the chance to study with her.
